snippet: Pamela Hepburn, the captain of the Pegasus, said she hoped to have the boat operating this summer, but its operators no longer have the money to maintain it.
abstract: Pegasus, 108-year-old tugboat that was once fixture on Manhattan's West Side and remains symbol of New York City's maritime history, has been moved to Jersey City dock; Tug Pegasus Preservation Project, nonprofit that operates tug, says it no longer has funding to maintain vessel; tug's captain Pamela Hepburn retired Pegasus from commercial work in 1997, turning it into floating museum and educational center.
lead_paragraph: Pamela Hepburn, the captain of the Pegasus, said she hoped to have the boat operating this summer, but its operators no longer have the money to maintain it.

headline.main: Pegasus, a Tugboat and Floating Museum, Hits Rough Waters
headline.print_headline: A Floating Museum, Age 108, Hits Rough Waters
